elements.content: Three metal-calixarene compounds with N,N-bis­[1­(2)H-tetrazol-5-yl]­amine (H3bta), [Co16Cl6(TC4A)4­(Hbta)4­(CH3OH)10­(OH)2­(H2O)6] (CIAC-232), [Co17(TC4A)4­(bta)4­(HCOO)6­(CH3OH)4­(H2O)4] (CIAC-233), and [Co20Cl2(TC4A)5­(bta)2(atz)2­(HCOO)2­(ox)4(CH3OH)6­(H2O)4] (CIAC-234) (H4TC4A = p-tert-butylthiacalix­[4]­arene, H2ox = oxalic acid, Hatz = 5-aminotetrazole), were obtained under the solvothermal conditions in different solvents. CIAC-232 featuring an isolated {Co16} cluster was synthesized in the sole methanol solvent, while CIAC-233 contained some coordination chains from a mixed methanol–DMF solvent. In-situ generated formic acid from the decomposition of DMF acts as the linker to bridge the isolated {Co17} clusters into the coordination chains in CIAC-233. The attempt to replace the formate linkers with the oxalate anions results in the formation of a helmet-like open {Co20} coordination cage CIAC-234 due to the different coordination geometries of the oxalate anions. Magnetic properties and gas adsorption of these compounds were studied.
elements.clean_text: Three metal-calixarene compounds with N,N-bis[1(2)H-tetrazol-5-yl]amine (H3bta), [Co16Cl6(TC4A)4(Hbta)4(CH3OH)10(OH)2(H2O)6] (CIAC-232), [Co17(TC4A)4(bta)4(HCOO)6(CH3OH)4(H2O)4] (CIAC-233), and [Co20Cl2(TC4A)5(bta)2(atz)2(HCOO)2(ox)4(CH3OH)6(H2O)4] (CIAC-234) (H4TC4A = p-tert-butylthiacalix[4]arene, H2ox = oxalic acid, Hatz = 5-aminotetrazole), were obtained under the solvothermal conditions in different solvents. CIAC-232 featuring an isolated {Co16} cluster was synthesized in the sole methanol solvent, while CIAC-233 contained some coordination chains from a mixed methanol-DMF solvent. In-situ generated formic acid from the decomposition of DMF acts as the linker to bridge the isolated {Co17} clusters into the coordination chains in CIAC-233. The attempt to replace the formate linkers with the oxalate anions results in the formation of a helmet-like open {Co20} coordination cage CIAC-234 due to the different coordination geometries of the oxalate anions. Magnetic properties and gas adsorption of these compounds were studied.

elements.content: Three calixarene-based coordination polynuclear compounds, isolated {Co16} cluster, one-dimensional {Co17} polymer, and helmet-like {Co20} cage, were obtained with a ditetrazole linker in different solvents.
elements.clean_text: Three calixarene-based coordination polynuclear compounds, isolated {Co16} cluster, one-dimensional {Co17} polymer, and helmet-like {Co20} cage, were obtained with a ditetrazole linker in different solvents.

elements.content: In the last few decades many researchers have put more zest into the study of coordination complexes because of their broad applications in porous materials, fluorescence imaging, magnetism, and catalysis. The structures and shapes of organic ligands were found to be crucial to the formation of the compounds. Calixarenes, a kind of macrocyclic ligand, were reported to be the effective multidentate ligands for the construction of polynuclear compounds. It was found that the shuttlecock-like {MII x -calixarene} n+ motif is a common secondary building unit (SBU) which can be linked together by some deliberately chosen di-/tricarboxylates, N-donor ligands, and bifunctional reagents. For instance, some {Co24} octahedral nanocages and {Co16} window frame-like squares were constructed by bridging the {M4-TC4A} SBUs with aromatic di-/tricarboxylates and their derivatives, while isolated octa-/decanuclear clusters (azide anions), {Co24} metallamacrocycle (1,2,4-triazole), {Ni12/Co12}, {Co16} clusters (5-methyltetrazolates), and {Co32} tetragonal prismatic coordination cage (bis-tetrazole ligand) were obtained with the N-donor linkers. Some {Ni8/12/16}, {Co12/16}, {Co20}, and {Co24} coordination nanocages (inorganic phosphate or organic phosphonate ligands), {Co16} tetrahedral coordination cages (5-(5-fluoropyridin-3-yl)­isophthalic acid and 5-(pyridin-3-yl)­isophthalic acid), and {Ni40} Johnson-type (J 17) hexadecahedron ((pyridin-4-yl)­isophthalate) were synthesized with bifunctional ligands. So the structures and shapes of the linkers would affect the formation of the compounds and their structures. The well-designed ligands might lead to some unprecedented structures.
elements.clean_text:
Introduction

In the last few decades many researchers have put more zest into the study of coordination complexes because of their broad applications in porous materials, fluorescence imaging, magnetism, and catalysis. The structures and shapes of organic ligands were found to be crucial to the formation of the compounds. Calixarenes, a kind of macrocyclic ligand, were reported to be the effective multidentate ligands for the construction of polynuclear compounds. It was found that the shuttlecock-like {MII  x -calixarene} n+ motif is a common secondary building unit (SBU) which can be linked together by some deliberately chosen di-/tricarboxylates, N-donor ligands, and bifunctional reagents. For instance, some {Co24} octahedral nanocages and {Co16} window frame-like squares were constructed by bridging the {M4-TC4A} SBUs with aromatic di-/tricarboxylates and their derivatives, while isolated octa-/decanuclear clusters (azide anions), {Co24} metallamacrocycle (1,2,4-triazole), {Ni12/Co12}, {Co16} clusters (5-methyltetrazolates), and {Co32} tetragonal prismatic coordination cage (bis-tetrazole ligand) were obtained with the N-donor linkers. Some {Ni8/12/16}, {Co12/16}, {Co20}, and {Co24} coordination nanocages (inorganic phosphate or organic phosphonate ligands), {Co16} tetrahedral coordination cages (5-(5-fluoropyridin-3-yl)isophthalic acid and 5-(pyridin-3-yl)isophthalic acid), and {Ni40} Johnson-type (J 17) hexadecahedron ((pyridin-4-yl)isophthalate) were synthesized with bifunctional ligands. So the structures and shapes of the linkers would affect the formation of the compounds and their structures. The well-designed ligands might lead to some unprecedented structures.

elements.content: It is generally acknowledged that tetrazole ligands with various coordination modes can bridge metal ions/clusters into varied structures, and many factors such as the solvent, pH value, counterion and temperature would influence the eventual structures. Here a ditetrazole ligand N,N-bis­[1­(2)H-tetrazol-5-yl]­amine (H3bta) was chosen as the linker on basis of the following considerations: it has four reversible species of non-deprotonated H3bta, mono-deprotonated H2bta–, doubly deprotonated Hbta2–, and triply deprotonated bta3– anions, versatile coordination modes, and flexible conformation. Three polynuclear cobalt compounds were successfully obtained with/without additional oxalic acid from different solvents under the solvothermal condition. The syntheses, crystal structures, and magnetic properties of the title complexes are presented. Moreover, the N2 adsorption property of CIAC-234 was also investigated.
elements.clean_text: It is generally acknowledged that tetrazole ligands with various coordination modes can bridge metal ions/clusters into varied structures, and many factors such as the solvent, pH value, counterion and temperature would influence the eventual structures. Here a ditetrazole ligand N,N-bis[1(2)H-tetrazol-5-yl]amine (H3bta) was chosen as the linker on basis of the following considerations: it has four reversible species of non-deprotonated H3bta, mono-deprotonated H2bta-, doubly deprotonated Hbta2-, and triply deprotonated bta3- anions, versatile coordination modes, and flexible conformation. Three polynuclear cobalt compounds were successfully obtained with/without additional oxalic acid from different solvents under the solvothermal condition. The syntheses, crystal structures, and magnetic properties of the title complexes are presented. Moreover, the N2 adsorption property of CIAC-234 was also investigated.

elements.content: The ligand H4TC4A was prepared with the method reported in the literature. The other chemicals were purchased and used as received without further purification. The IR spectra were recorded in a wavenumber range from 400 to 4000 cm–1 with a Bruker IFS 66 V/S FT-IR spectrometer. The elemental analysis was processed on a PerkinElmer 2400 spectrometer. Powder X-ray diffraction (PXRD) was performed on a Bruker X-ray diffractometer (Cu Kα, λ = 1.5418 Å) in a range of 5–50° (2θ) with a 5°/min scanning rate. Thermogravimetric analyses (TGA) was performed on a PerkinElmer thermal analyzer under N2 atmosphere with a heating rate of 5 °C·min–1. The magnetic susceptibility was measured on a Quantum Design MPMS XL-7 SQUID system in the temperature range 2–300 K under a field of 1000 Oe. Diamagnetic corrections were applied to the collected data. Gas sorption was measured on an ASAP 2020 surface area and porous analyzer.
elements.clean_text:
Experimental Section

Materials and General Methods

The ligand H4TC4A was prepared with the method reported in the literature. The other chemicals were purchased and used as received without further purification. The IR spectra were recorded in a wavenumber range from 400 to 4000 cm-1 with a Bruker IFS 66 V/S FT-IR spectrometer. The elemental analysis was processed on a PerkinElmer 2400 spectrometer. Powder X-ray diffraction (PXRD) was performed on a Bruker X-ray diffractometer (Cu Kα, λ = 1.5418 Å) in a range of 5-50° (2θ) with a 5°/min scanning rate. Thermogravimetric analyses (TGA) was performed on a PerkinElmer thermal analyzer under N2 atmosphere with a heating rate of 5 °C⋅min-1. The magnetic susceptibility was measured on a Quantum Design MPMS XL-7 SQUID system in the temperature range 2-300 K under a field of 1000 Oe. Diamagnetic corrections were applied to the collected data. Gas sorption was measured on an ASAP 2020 surface area and porous analyzer.

elements.content: A mixture of CoCl2·6H2O (100 mg, 0.4 mmol), H4TC4A (72 mg, 0.1 mmol), H3bta (23 mg, 0.15 mmol), and CH3OH (10 mL) was sealed in a Teflon-lined stainless steel container (23 mL) which was kept at 130 °C for 3 days. After the container was cooled to room temperature at 4 °C·h–1, yellow plate crystals were isolated with a yield of 62% based on Co. Elemental analysis: Calcd (%) for C178H234Cl6Co16N36O34S16: C 41.96, H 4.60, N 9.90. Found: C, 41.46; H, 4.40, N, 9.87. IR bands (KBr pellet, cm–1): 3329(s), 1868(s), 1634­(m), 1515­(m), 1312­(m), 1324­(m), 1110­(m), 955­(w), 852­(w), 692­(w), 584­(w), 472­(w).
elements.clean_text:
Syntheses of Compounds CIAC-232-234 

Compound CIAC-232 

A mixture of CoCl2⋅6H2O (100 mg, 0.4 mmol), H4TC4A (72 mg, 0.1 mmol), H3bta (23 mg, 0.15 mmol), and CH3OH (10 mL) was sealed in a Teflon-lined stainless steel container (23 mL) which was kept at 130 °C for 3 days. After the container was cooled to room temperature at 4 °C⋅h-1, yellow plate crystals were isolated with a yield of 62% based on Co. Elemental analysis: Calcd (%) for C178H234Cl6Co16N36O34S16: C 41.96, H 4.60, N 9.90. Found: C, 41.46; H, 4.40, N, 9.87. IR bands (KBr pellet, cm-1): 3329(s), 1868(s), 1634(m), 1515(m), 1312(m), 1324(m), 1110(m), 955(w), 852(w), 692(w), 584(w), 472(w).

elements.content: CIAC-233 was synthesized by a similar way as CIAC-232, except that CH3OH solvent (10 mL) was substituted by a mixture of CH3OH (5 mL) and DMF (5 mL). Yellow block crystals were isolated with a yield of 68% based on Co. Elemental analysis: Calcd (%) for C178H206Co17N36O36S16: C 43.23, H 4.17, N 10.20. Found: C 43.28, H 4.18, N, 10.18. IR bands (KBr pellet, cm–1): 3738(s), 3013(s), 1851(s), 1491(s), 1312­(m), 1157­(m), 955­(m), 852­(m), 776­(m), 680­(w), 575­(w), 465­(w).
elements.clean_text:
Compound CIAC-233 

 CIAC-233 was synthesized by a similar way as CIAC-232, except that CH3OH solvent (10 mL) was substituted by a mixture of CH3OH (5 mL) and DMF (5 mL). Yellow block crystals were isolated with a yield of 68% based on Co. Elemental analysis: Calcd (%) for C178H206Co17N36O36S16: C 43.23, H 4.17, N 10.20. Found: C 43.28, H 4.18, N, 10.18. IR bands (KBr pellet, cm-1): 3738(s), 3013(s), 1851(s), 1491(s), 1312(m), 1157(m), 955(m), 852(m), 776(m), 680(w), 575(w), 465(w).

elements.content: Compound CIAC-234 was synthesized by a similar way as CIAC-233, except there was oxalic acid (9 mg, 0.05 mmol) in the mixture. The product was isolated as yellow block crystals in 65% yield based on Co. Elemental analysis: Calcd (%) for C222H258Cl2Co20N28O50S20: C 44.33, H 4.29, N 6.52. Found: C 44.38, H 4.28, N 6.49. IR bands (KBr pellet, cm–1): 3009(s), 1509(s), 1395(s), 1333­(m), 1193­(m), 1098­(m), 975­(m), 883­(m), 697­(w), 584­(w), 465­(w).
elements.clean_text:
Compound CIAC-234 

Compound CIAC-234 was synthesized by a similar way as CIAC-233, except there was oxalic acid (9 mg, 0.05 mmol) in the mixture. The product was isolated as yellow block crystals in 65% yield based on Co. Elemental analysis: Calcd (%) for C222H258Cl2Co20N28O50S20: C 44.33, H 4.29, N 6.52. Found: C 44.38, H 4.28, N 6.49. IR bands (KBr pellet, cm-1): 3009(s), 1509(s), 1395(s), 1333(m), 1193(m), 1098(m), 975(m), 883(m), 697(w), 584(w), 465(w).

elements.content: The single crystal diffraction data of CIAC-232--234 were collected on a Bruker D8 QUEST system with a Cu–Kα radiation (λ = 1.54178 Å). The direct method was chosen to solve the crystal structures, and the refinement was performed with full-matrix least-squares on F 2 using the reported SHELXL-2016 program. The “SQUEEZE” method from the PLATON package was applied to subtract the electronic density of the solvent molecules from the crystal structure. The hydrogen atoms were generated theoretically and refined isotropically with fixed thermal factors. All non-hydrogen atoms except the disordered butyl groups were refined anisotropically. The molecular formula shown in this paper did not include the unidentified counterions and solvent molecules. After the final refinement, the R factors were still relatively large, which should be due to the weak diffraction even at 150 K. The crystal data and refinement details are given in Table S1. The number CCDC 1553186–1553188 has been assigned for CIAC-232-234. The data can be obtained free of charge from The Cambridge Crystallographic Data Centre via http://www.ccdc.cam.ac.uk)
elements.clean_text:
X-ray Data Collection and Structure Determination

The single crystal diffraction data of CIAC-232--234 were collected on a Bruker D8 QUEST system with a Cu-Kα radiation (λ = 1.54178 Å). The direct method was chosen to solve the crystal structures, and the refinement was performed with full-matrix least-squares on F 2 using the reported SHELXL-2016 program. The "SQUEEZE" method from the PLATON package was applied to subtract the electronic density of the solvent molecules from the crystal structure. The hydrogen atoms were generated theoretically and refined isotropically with fixed thermal factors. All non-hydrogen atoms except the disordered butyl groups were refined anisotropically. The molecular formula shown in this paper did not include the unidentified counterions and solvent molecules. After the final refinement, the R factors were still relatively large, which should be due to the weak diffraction even at 150 K. The crystal data and refinement details are given in Table S1. The number CCDC 1553186-1553188 has been assigned for CIAC-232-234. The data can be obtained free of charge from The Cambridge Crystallographic Data Centre via http://www.ccdc.cam.ac.uk)

elements.content: As shown in , the isolated {Co16} cluster (CIAC-232) was synthesized in the sole CH3OH solvent, while a one-dimensional (1D) coordination polymer (CIAC-233) was obtained with the in situ generated HCOO– anions in a mixed solvent of CH3OH and DMF. In order to replace the HCOO– anions in CIAC-233, oxalic acid was added into the reaction system, which leads to the formation of CIAC-234 due to more coordination sites of oxalate anions. It should be noted that compounds CIAC-233 and CIAC-234 could not be obtained with formic acid or oxalic acid added into the sole MeOH system.
elements.clean_text:
Results and Discussion

As shown in , the isolated {Co16} cluster (CIAC-232) was synthesized in the sole CH3OH solvent, while a one-dimensional (1D) coordination polymer (CIAC-233) was obtained with the in situ generated HCOO- anions in a mixed solvent of CH3OH and DMF. In order to replace the HCOO- anions in CIAC-233, oxalic acid was added into the reaction system, which leads to the formation of CIAC-234 due to more coordination sites of oxalate anions. It should be noted that compounds CIAC-233 and CIAC-234 could not be obtained with formic acid or oxalic acid added into the sole MeOH system.

elements.content: Single crystal X-ray diffraction analyses revealed that all these three compounds are feathered with some bta-bridged double shuttlecock-like Co4-TC4A SBUs (bis-Co4-TC4A SBUs), which are further interconnected into the isolated polynuclear entities or chains. The bta ligands play a key role in the formation of these compounds due to their rich coordination geometries ().
elements.clean_text: Single crystal X-ray diffraction analyses revealed that all these three compounds are feathered with some bta-bridged double shuttlecock-like Co4-TC4A SBUs (bis-Co4-TC4A SBUs), which are further interconnected into the isolated polynuclear entities or chains. The bta ligands play a key role in the formation of these compounds due to their rich coordination geometries ().

elements.content: CIAC-232 crystallizes in the triclinic system with the space group P1̅. The structure is featured with an isolated {Co16} cluster containing two bis-Co4-TC4A SBUs (). There are eight crystallographically independent cobalt atoms (Co1–Co8) which are all six-coordinated. All these cobalt atoms are bonded by one sulfur bridge and two phenoxo μ2-O atoms from a calixarene molecule. Sites Co1–Co4 are also coordinated by one nitrogen atom while Co5–Co8 by two nitrogen atoms. Beside these atoms, Co1 is bonded by one water molecule and one chloride anion, Co2 and Co4 by one methanol molecule and one chloride anion, and Co3 by one methanol and one water molecule. Co5 is coordinated by one methanol, Co6 and Co7 by one water molecule, and Co8 by one chloride anion. Bond valence sum calculations reveal that all cobalt atoms are divalent. Four adjacent cobalt atoms, Co1–Co4 or Co5–Co8, bond a calixarene molecule adopting the cone conformation to form a shuttlecock-like Co4-TC4A SBU which is connected with another by two parallel bta ligands into a bis-Co4-TC4A SBU. It is obvious that two tetrazole subunit of a bta ligand bond two different Co4-TC4A SBUs by the N–N edges. Two such bis-Co4-TC4A SBUs are then interconnected into a {Co16} cluster through four Co–N bonds (). In other words, the {Co16} cluster can be thought to be constructed by bridging four Co4-TC4A SBUs with four bta ligands. So the rich coordination sites and coordination modes are important for the formation of the {Co16} cluster. And then these clusters are stacked into an extended structure through supramolecular interactions ().
elements.clean_text: CIAC-232 crystallizes in the triclinic system with the space group P1̅. The structure is featured with an isolated {Co16} cluster containing two bis-Co4-TC4A SBUs (). There are eight crystallographically independent cobalt atoms (Co1-Co8) which are all six-coordinated. All these cobalt atoms are bonded by one sulfur bridge and two phenoxo μ2-O atoms from a calixarene molecule. Sites Co1-Co4 are also coordinated by one nitrogen atom while Co5-Co8 by two nitrogen atoms. Beside these atoms, Co1 is bonded by one water molecule and one chloride anion, Co2 and Co4 by one methanol molecule and one chloride anion, and Co3 by one methanol and one water molecule. Co5 is coordinated by one methanol, Co6 and Co7 by one water molecule, and Co8 by one chloride anion. Bond valence sum calculations reveal that all cobalt atoms are divalent. Four adjacent cobalt atoms, Co1-Co4 or Co5-Co8, bond a calixarene molecule adopting the cone conformation to form a shuttlecock-like Co4-TC4A SBU which is connected with another by two parallel bta ligands into a bis-Co4-TC4A SBU. It is obvious that two tetrazole subunit of a bta ligand bond two different Co4-TC4A SBUs by the N-N edges. Two such bis-Co4-TC4A SBUs are then interconnected into a {Co16} cluster through four Co-N bonds (). In other words, the {Co16} cluster can be thought to be constructed by bridging four Co4-TC4A SBUs with four bta ligands. So the rich coordination sites and coordination modes are important for the formation of the {Co16} cluster. And then these clusters are stacked into an extended structure through supramolecular interactions ().

elements.content: Extended structure of CIAC-232.
elements.clean_text: 2  Extended structure of CIAC-232.

elements.content: When the sole methanol solvent was replaced by a mixed solvent of DMF and methanol, compound CIAC-233 containing some 1D coordination chains was obtained. Crystal structure analyses reveal that the chains are constructed by bridging some {Co17} subunits with the in situ generated formic acid which was produced by the decomposition of DMF. Compound CIAC-233 crystallizes in a monoclinic system and the space group is C2/c. There are nine crystallographically independent Co­(II) sites with three different coordination geometries (octahedral, pyramidal, and tetrahedral environment). As shown in , two Co4-TC4A SBUs of a bis-Co4-TC4A unit bond the same tetrazole subunit of a bta ligand through two opposite N–N edges, while they bond different tetrazole subunits in CIAC-232 (). Two such bis-Co4-TC4A SBUs are bonded together through a cobalt cation located between two face-to-face bta ligands. And then the bis-Co4-TC4A SBUs are interconnected into a chain by the HCOO– anions. The chains are further stacked into a supramolecular extended structure (). It should be noted that the formate anions act as not only the bridges but also the terminal ligands (). Different from those parallel in CIAC-232, two pair of the bta ligands of a {Co17} cluster in CIAC-233 are not parallel but with a dihedral angle of 73.7°.
elements.clean_text: When the sole methanol solvent was replaced by a mixed solvent of DMF and methanol, compound CIAC-233 containing some 1D coordination chains was obtained. Crystal structure analyses reveal that the chains are constructed by bridging some {Co17} subunits with the in situ generated formic acid which was produced by the decomposition of DMF. Compound CIAC-233 crystallizes in a monoclinic system and the space group is C2/c. There are nine crystallographically independent Co(II) sites with three different coordination geometries (octahedral, pyramidal, and tetrahedral environment). As shown in , two Co4-TC4A SBUs of a bis-Co4-TC4A unit bond the same tetrazole subunit of a bta ligand through two opposite N-N edges, while they bond different tetrazole subunits in CIAC-232 (). Two such bis-Co4-TC4A SBUs are bonded together through a cobalt cation located between two face-to-face bta ligands. And then the bis-Co4-TC4A SBUs are interconnected into a chain by the HCOO- anions. The chains are further stacked into a supramolecular extended structure (). It should be noted that the formate anions act as not only the bridges but also the terminal ligands (). Different from those parallel in CIAC-232, two pair of the bta ligands of a {Co17} cluster in CIAC-233 are not parallel but with a dihedral angle of 73.7°.

elements.content: A bis-Co4-TC4A SBU (a), a {Co17} cluster (b), coordination modes of the formate anions (c) and 1D entity of the {Co17} clusters bridged by the formate anions (d) in CIAC-233.
elements.clean_text: 3  A bis-Co4-TC4A SBU (a), a {Co17} cluster (b), coordination modes of the formate anions (c) and 1D entity of the {Co17} clusters bridged by the formate anions (d) in CIAC-233.

elements.content: Arrangement of the coordination chains in CIAC-233. The butyl groups are deleted for clarity.
elements.clean_text: 4  Arrangement of the coordination chains in CIAC-233. The butyl groups are deleted for clarity.

elements.content: The attempt to replace the HCOO– bridges with the oxalate anions results in the formation of a helmet-like open {Co20} coordination cage (CIAC-234) which is constructed by linking two bis-Co4-TC4A SBUs and one Co4-TC4A SBU with the ox ligands (). Compound CIAC-234 also crystallizes in the monoclinic system but with C2/m space group. There are 11 cobalt sites with different coordination geometries. As in the above compounds, four adjacent cobalt atoms bond to a cone-shaped calixarene molecule to form a Co4-TC4A SBU. A bis-Co4-TC4A SBU forms by interconnecting two Co4-TC4A SBUs with a bta ligand and an atz molecule in situ generated by the decomposition of bta. As in CIAC-233, two Co4-TC4A subunits of a bis-Co4-TC4A SBU bond the same tetrazole subunit of a bta ligand through two opposite N–N edges. Two ox ligands bridge two bis-Co4-TC4A SBUs into a coordination square which is capped by a Co4-TC4A SBU to form a helmet-like open cage. This helmet-like motif is different from the reported one which is formed through linking five Co4-TC4A SBUs by eight HPO4 2– anions. The extended structure is constructed by stacking the isolated open coordination cages through supramolecular interactions (). The PLATON analysis reveals that the potential solvent-accessible volume would be ca. 39.7%, which might be occupied by the disordered solvent molecules (CH3OH and DMF molecules).
elements.clean_text: The attempt to replace the HCOO- bridges with the oxalate anions results in the formation of a helmet-like open {Co20} coordination cage (CIAC-234) which is constructed by linking two bis-Co4-TC4A SBUs and one Co4-TC4A SBU with the ox ligands (). Compound CIAC-234 also crystallizes in the monoclinic system but with C2/m space group. There are 11 cobalt sites with different coordination geometries. As in the above compounds, four adjacent cobalt atoms bond to a cone-shaped calixarene molecule to form a Co4-TC4A SBU. A bis-Co4-TC4A SBU forms by interconnecting two Co4-TC4A SBUs with a bta ligand and an atz molecule in situ generated by the decomposition of bta. As in CIAC-233, two Co4-TC4A subunits of a bis-Co4-TC4A SBU bond the same tetrazole subunit of a bta ligand through two opposite N-N edges. Two ox ligands bridge two bis-Co4-TC4A SBUs into a coordination square which is capped by a Co4-TC4A SBU to form a helmet-like open cage. This helmet-like motif is different from the reported one which is formed through linking five Co4-TC4A SBUs by eight HPO4 2- anions. The extended structure is constructed by stacking the isolated open coordination cages through supramolecular interactions (). The PLATON analysis reveals that the potential solvent-accessible volume would be ca. 39.7%, which might be occupied by the disordered solvent molecules (CH3OH and DMF molecules).

elements.content: The solid state magnetic susceptibility for compound CIAC-232–234 was measured in 2–300 K with an applied field of 1000 Oe (). The room temperature χM T values for CIAC-232–234 are 37.4, 39.7, and 46.7 cm3 mol–1 K, respectively, which is in accord with the spin–orbit coupling result of the {Co16}, {Co17}, and {Co20} clusters. When cooling from 300 to 2 K, the χM T values first decrease smoothly to about 100 K and then drop quickly to 2 K. The χM –1 data are fitted with the Curie–Weiss equations in a temperature range of 50–300 K for CIAC-232, 25–300 K for CIAC-233, and 50–300 K for CIAC-234. The best fittings gave θ = −84.2 K for CIAC-232, θ = −113.2 K for CIAC-233, and θ = −91.2 K for CIAC-234, which indicates an antiferromagnetic interaction between the CoII atoms. The much larger absolute value of θ for compound CIAC-233 indicates the strongest antiferromagnetic coupling between the CoII cations in the crystal structure.
elements.clean_text:
Magnetic Studies

The solid state magnetic susceptibility for compound CIAC-232-234 was measured in 2-300 K with an applied field of 1000 Oe (). The room temperature χM T values for CIAC-232-234 are 37.4, 39.7, and 46.7 cm3 mol-1 K, respectively, which is in accord with the spin-orbit coupling result of the {Co16}, {Co17}, and {Co20} clusters. When cooling from 300 to 2 K, the χM T values first decrease smoothly to about 100 K and then drop quickly to 2 K. The χM -1 data are fitted with the Curie-Weiss equations in a temperature range of 50-300 K for CIAC-232, 25-300 K for CIAC-233, and 50-300 K for CIAC-234. The best fittings gave θ = -84.2 K for CIAC-232, θ = -113.2 K for CIAC-233, and θ = -91.2 K for CIAC-234, which indicates an antiferromagnetic interaction between the CoII atoms. The much larger absolute value of θ for compound CIAC-233 indicates the strongest antiferromagnetic coupling between the CoII cations in the crystal structure.

elements.content: Plots of χM T vs T and χM –1 vs T for compound CIAC-232–234. The solid lines represent the best fittings according to the Curie–Weiss equation.
elements.clean_text: 7  Plots of χM T vs T and χM -1 vs T for compound CIAC-232-234. The solid lines represent the best fittings according to the Curie-Weiss equation.

elements.content: The activated compound CIAC-234 was subjected to N2 adsorption at 77 K. For N2 adsorption measurement, the samples of CIAC-234 were soaked in methanol to exchange the solvent molecules in the voids, and then dried in a vacuum at 100 °C after being soaked three times. As shown in , the N2 adsorption isotherm exhibits a gas adsorption behavior of the materials having both micropores and mesopores (the pore size distribution shown in Figure S7). The Brunauer–Emmett–Teller (BET) surface area is estimated to be 237.2 m2·g–1 and the Langmuir surface area is 270.4 m2·g–1. There is a obvious hysteresis of desorption in the isotherm, which might be due to the adsorption of the interstices between the isolated coordination cages and the partially blocked apertures in the extended structure.
elements.clean_text:
N2 Adsorption

The activated compound CIAC-234 was subjected to N2 adsorption at 77 K. For N2 adsorption measurement, the samples of CIAC-234 were soaked in methanol to exchange the solvent molecules in the voids, and then dried in a vacuum at 100 °C after being soaked three times. As shown in , the N2 adsorption isotherm exhibits a gas adsorption behavior of the materials having both micropores and mesopores (the pore size distribution shown in Figure S7). The Brunauer-Emmett-Teller (BET) surface area is estimated to be 237.2 m2⋅g-1 and the Langmuir surface area is 270.4 m2⋅g-1. There is a obvious hysteresis of desorption in the isotherm, which might be due to the adsorption of the interstices between the isolated coordination cages and the partially blocked apertures in the extended structure.

elements.content: N2 adsorption isotherms at 77 K for compound CIAC-234.
elements.clean_text: 8  N2 adsorption isotherms at 77 K for compound CIAC-234.

elements.content: In summary, three calixarene-based coordination polynuclear compounds, isolated {Co16} cluster, 1D {Co17} polymer, and helmet-like {Co20} cage, were obtained without/with ancillary oxalic acid in different solvents. The in situ generated formate ligand from the decomposition of DMF is crucial to the formation of coordination chains and open cages. The ditetrazole ligand bis[1(2)H-tetrazol-5-yl]­amine is found to be an effective one in the construction of metal-calixarene compounds due to its rich coordination sites and versatile coordination modes. It seems possible to obtain more calixarene-based coordination compounds having fascinating structures and interesting properties by choosing some deliberate ditetrazole ligands.
elements.clean_text:
Conclusion

In summary, three calixarene-based coordination polynuclear compounds, isolated {Co16} cluster, 1D {Co17} polymer, and helmet-like {Co20} cage, were obtained without/with ancillary oxalic acid in different solvents. The in situ generated formate ligand from the decomposition of DMF is crucial to the formation of coordination chains and open cages. The ditetrazole ligand bis[1(2)H-tetrazol-5-yl]amine is found to be an effective one in the construction of metal-calixarene compounds due to its rich coordination sites and versatile coordination modes. It seems possible to obtain more calixarene-based coordination compounds having fascinating structures and interesting properties by choosing some deliberate ditetrazole ligands.

cln_elements.content:
A mixture of CoCl2·6H2O (100 mg, 0.4 mmol), H4TC4A (72 mg, 0.1 mmol), H3bta (23 mg, 0.15 mmol), and CH3OH (10 mL) was sealed in a Teflon-lined stainless steel container (23 mL) which was kept at 130 °C for 3 days. After the container was cooled to room temperature at 4 °C·h–1, yellow plate crystals were isolated with a yield of 62% based on Co. Elemental analysis: Calcd (%) for C178H234Cl6Co16N36O34S16: C 41.96, H 4.60, N 9.90. Found: C, 41.46; H, 4.40, N, 9.87. IR bands (KBr pellet, cm–1): 3329(s), 1868(s), 1634­(m), 1515­(m), 1312­(m), 1324­(m), 1110­(m), 955­(w), 852­(w), 692­(w), 584­(w), 472­(w).

Compound <bold>CIAC-233</bold>

CIAC-233 was synthesized by a similar way as CIAC-232, except that CH3OH solvent (10 mL) was substituted by a mixture of CH3OH (5 mL) and DMF (5 mL). Yellow block crystals were isolated with a yield of 68% based on Co. Elemental analysis: Calcd (%) for C178H206Co17N36O36S16: C 43.23, H 4.17, N 10.20. Found: C 43.28, H 4.18, N, 10.18. IR bands (KBr pellet, cm–1): 3738(s), 3013(s), 1851(s), 1491(s), 1312­(m), 1157­(m), 955­(m), 852­(m), 776­(m), 680­(w), 575­(w), 465­(w).

Compound <bold>CIAC-234</bold>

Compound CIAC-234 was synthesized by a similar way as CIAC-233, except there was oxalic acid (9 mg, 0.05 mmol) in the mixture. The product was isolated as yellow block crystals in 65% yield based on Co. Elemental analysis: Calcd (%) for C222H258Cl2Co20N28O50S20: C 44.33, H 4.29, N 6.52. Found: C 44.38, H 4.28, N 6.49. IR bands (KBr pellet, cm–1): 3009(s), 1509(s), 1395(s), 1333­(m), 1193­(m), 1098­(m), 975­(m), 883­(m), 697­(w), 584­(w), 465­(w).
cln_elements.clean_text:
Syntheses of Compounds CIAC-232-234 

Compound CIAC-232 

A mixture of CoCl2⋅6H2O (100 mg, 0.4 mmol), H4TC4A (72 mg, 0.1 mmol), H3bta (23 mg, 0.15 mmol), and CH3OH (10 mL) was sealed in a Teflon-lined stainless steel container (23 mL) which was kept at 130 °C for 3 days. After the container was cooled to room temperature at 4 °C⋅h-1, yellow plate crystals were isolated with a yield of 62% based on Co. Elemental analysis: Calcd (%) for C178H234Cl6Co16N36O34S16: C 41.96, H 4.60, N 9.90. Found: C, 41.46; H, 4.40, N, 9.87. IR bands (KBr pellet, cm-1): 3329(s), 1868(s), 1634(m), 1515(m), 1312(m), 1324(m), 1110(m), 955(w), 852(w), 692(w), 584(w), 472(w).

Compound CIAC-233 

 CIAC-233 was synthesized by a similar way as CIAC-232, except that CH3OH solvent (10 mL) was substituted by a mixture of CH3OH (5 mL) and DMF (5 mL). Yellow block crystals were isolated with a yield of 68% based on Co. Elemental analysis: Calcd (%) for C178H206Co17N36O36S16: C 43.23, H 4.17, N 10.20. Found: C 43.28, H 4.18, N, 10.18. IR bands (KBr pellet, cm-1): 3738(s), 3013(s), 1851(s), 1491(s), 1312(m), 1157(m), 955(m), 852(m), 776(m), 680(w), 575(w), 465(w).

Compound CIAC-234 

Compound CIAC-234 was synthesized by a similar way as CIAC-233, except there was oxalic acid (9 mg, 0.05 mmol) in the mixture. The product was isolated as yellow block crystals in 65% yield based on Co. Elemental analysis: Calcd (%) for C222H258Cl2Co20N28O50S20: C 44.33, H 4.29, N 6.52. Found: C 44.38, H 4.28, N 6.49. IR bands (KBr pellet, cm-1): 3009(s), 1509(s), 1395(s), 1333(m), 1193(m), 1098(m), 975(m), 883(m), 697(w), 584(w), 465(w).

cln_elements.content:
The solid state magnetic susceptibility for compound CIAC-232–234 was measured in 2–300 K with an applied field of 1000 Oe (). The room temperature χM T values for CIAC-232–234 are 37.4, 39.7, and 46.7 cm3 mol–1 K, respectively, which is in accord with the spin–orbit coupling result of the {Co16}, {Co17}, and {Co20} clusters. When cooling from 300 to 2 K, the χM T values first decrease smoothly to about 100 K and then drop quickly to 2 K. The χM –1 data are fitted with the Curie–Weiss equations in a temperature range of 50–300 K for CIAC-232, 25–300 K for CIAC-233, and 50–300 K for CIAC-234. The best fittings gave θ = −84.2 K for CIAC-232, θ = −113.2 K for CIAC-233, and θ = −91.2 K for CIAC-234, which indicates an antiferromagnetic interaction between the CoII atoms. The much larger absolute value of θ for compound CIAC-233 indicates the strongest antiferromagnetic coupling between the CoII cations in the crystal structure.

N<sub>2</sub> Adsorption

The activated compound CIAC-234 was subjected to N2 adsorption at 77 K. For N2 adsorption measurement, the samples of CIAC-234 were soaked in methanol to exchange the solvent molecules in the voids, and then dried in a vacuum at 100 °C after being soaked three times. As shown in , the N2 adsorption isotherm exhibits a gas adsorption behavior of the materials having both micropores and mesopores (the pore size distribution shown in Figure S7). The Brunauer–Emmett–Teller (BET) surface area is estimated to be 237.2 m2·g–1 and the Langmuir surface area is 270.4 m2·g–1. There is a obvious hysteresis of desorption in the isotherm, which might be due to the adsorption of the interstices between the isolated coordination cages and the partially blocked apertures in the extended structure.
cln_elements.clean_text:
Magnetic Studies

The solid state magnetic susceptibility for compound CIAC-232-234 was measured in 2-300 K with an applied field of 1000 Oe (). The room temperature χM T values for CIAC-232-234 are 37.4, 39.7, and 46.7 cm3 mol-1 K, respectively, which is in accord with the spin-orbit coupling result of the {Co16}, {Co17}, and {Co20} clusters. When cooling from 300 to 2 K, the χM T values first decrease smoothly to about 100 K and then drop quickly to 2 K. The χM -1 data are fitted with the Curie-Weiss equations in a temperature range of 50-300 K for CIAC-232, 25-300 K for CIAC-233, and 50-300 K for CIAC-234. The best fittings gave θ = -84.2 K for CIAC-232, θ = -113.2 K for CIAC-233, and θ = -91.2 K for CIAC-234, which indicates an antiferromagnetic interaction between the CoII atoms. The much larger absolute value of θ for compound CIAC-233 indicates the strongest antiferromagnetic coupling between the CoII cations in the crystal structure.

N2 Adsorption

The activated compound CIAC-234 was subjected to N2 adsorption at 77 K. For N2 adsorption measurement, the samples of CIAC-234 were soaked in methanol to exchange the solvent molecules in the voids, and then dried in a vacuum at 100 °C after being soaked three times. As shown in , the N2 adsorption isotherm exhibits a gas adsorption behavior of the materials having both micropores and mesopores (the pore size distribution shown in Figure S7). The Brunauer-Emmett-Teller (BET) surface area is estimated to be 237.2 m2⋅g-1 and the Langmuir surface area is 270.4 m2⋅g-1. There is a obvious hysteresis of desorption in the isotherm, which might be due to the adsorption of the interstices between the isolated coordination cages and the partially blocked apertures in the extended structure.
